image.altText: A man wearing a baseball cap and blue jacket stands in front of a car with L plates

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is proposing changes to driver training laws, but some private driving instructors say the reforms could leave people with disability behind.

title.children: SA driving instructors say new laws will make it harder for people with disability to get their licence

image.altText: A yellow tram pulls up at a crowded tram stop.

props.synopsis: Labor has "gone cold" on its ambitious plans to revive Adelaide's tram network, as a public transport researcher warns the lack of new routes threatens the city's liveability.

title.children: Labor's tram revival on back burner despite warnings about future traffic congestion in Adelaide

image.altText: A man in military uniform standing at a podium flanked by two israeli flags

props.synopsis: Israel's military has warned residents in southern Lebanon to leave areas where Hezbollah may be operating, saying it is about to carry out "extensive, precise strikes against terror targets".

title.children: Israeli military issues warning to residents in southern Lebanon ahead of 'extensive attacks'

image.altText: man and woman on farm smile to camera holding a plant

props.synopsis: Some would say South Australia is too cold for the tropical agave plant, but one couple hopes to disprove that theory with the country's second-ever commercial agave planting.

title.children: Wine grape growers looking to diversify plant agave tequila crops in SA

image.altText: A banner reading 'Coles' and, in the background, the Woolworths logo.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission launches legal action against Woolworths and Coles, alleging the supermarket giants breached consumer law by misleading consumers through discount pricing claims on hundreds of products.

title.children: 'The conduct we are considering is very serious': ACCC launches action against Coles and Woolworths

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: Share prices of the big supermarkets have been hit hard on news the ACCC has hauled them into court alleging they had misled customers over hundreds of discounts, while the ASX 200 opened down 0.7pc after Wall Street's rate-cut rally came to a halt on Friday. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: PM speaks on supermarket code as Coles and Woolworths savaged on ASX

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coles and Woolworths hammered,  ASX down 0.7%
Weak manufacturing leads business activity contraction

image.altText: A football player and coach raise a premiership cup into the air

props.synopsis: Described as "one of the greats" with a thrilling finish that left exhausted bodies scattered across the field, Glenelg's back-to-back win against Norwood saw heroics that will be remembered for decades.

title.children: 'An absolute dogfight': Glenelg back-to-back premiership a thrilling spectacle for fans

image.altText: Bush at the proposed site of a hydrogen plant.

props.synopsis: It's the game-changing policy Labor didn't hold back on selling ahead of the 2022 SA election. But making a promise in opposition is one thing and actually delivering it in government is another, and the next three months loom as crucial for the hydrogen project's future.

title.children: Is a green hydrogen power play at risk of becoming a mirage in the scrub?

image.altText: Men search through rubble

props.synopsis: Chadi Fares sits on the sidewalk of a Beirut street, watching emergency workers pick their way through piles of twisted metal and slabs of collapsed concrete.

title.children: 'Everything is gone': Search for bodies after Israeli strike on Beirut residential building

image.altText: Senator McKim is mid sentence while standing in the Parliamentary Press Gallery.

props.synopsis: The demand that the treasurer intervene to cut rates unless governor Michele Bullock does so herself effectively sinks Jim Chalmers's chances of passing his reforms.

title.children: Greens demand hostile takeover of RBA in exchange for passing board reforms in likely death knell to treasurer's bill

image.altText: Western Sydney housing development Getty

props.synopsis: Perhaps no question matters more to households worn down by cost of living pressures, but the answer is not straightforward.

title.children: The four numbers that could tell us when interest rates will go down

image.altText: New Socceroos coach Tony Popovic sits a desk and answers questions from the media.

props.synopsis: Tony Popovic has been named the new head coach of the Socceroos, taking over after the sudden resignation of Graham Arnold.

title.children: Popovic named as new Socceroos coach ahead of crucial World Cup qualifers

image.altText: Rose Staleo

props.synopsis: The banking royal commission described the way in which mortgage brokers are paid as "conflicted remuneration" and "money for nothing". Customers don't care.

title.children: Three in four home loans are written by mortgage brokers, infuriating banks and delighting customers

image.altText: An old photograph of basketball players on an indoor court playing a game.

props.synopsis: In 1949, a picture of a basketballer in an American magazine sparked the beginning of Loxton basketball's 75-year journey. Now their story has gone global.

title.children: They went from a grassroots team to champions. Now a film on this small town's basketball team is going global

image.altText: Ken Hinkley looks on while wearing glasses on his head

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide's powerbrokers face a tough decision after another finals exist at the preliminary final stage. Unlocking the path to premiership glory may not be as simple as punting its best-ever coach.

title.children: Premiership-hunting Port Adelaide stuck between a rock and a hard place

image.altText: A man, photographed from behind so his face isn't visible, looks downcast

props.synopsis: When Ezekiel landed in Australia as a guest worker two years ago, he was full of hope. Two years later, he is in limbo, destitute and homeless with the company that sponsored him being investigated for abuse and mistreatment of workers.

title.children: Crisis point in regional towns as modern slavery overwhelms local services

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch stands at a lectern to give a speech, the projection of a US flag behind on screen

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch's court battle with his children is about more than money. He's fighting to keep his media empire conservative

title.children: 'The day Rupert dies is the day Lachlan gets fired': The words that rocked the Murdoch empire

image.altText: A cold glass of beer.

props.synopsis: David Littleproud faces a backlash from senior Liberals over the National Party leader's "freelancing" pledge to consider freezing beer excise under a future Coalition government.

title.children: Liberals pour cold beer on Littleproud excise freeze

image.altText: Donald Trump holds up a fist. A crowd is behind him.

props.synopsis: Former president Donald Trump says that he will not make a fourth consecutive run for the US presidency if he loses the upcoming election.

title.children: 'That will be it': Trump says he will not run again if he loses in November

image.altText: A man on a stage grasps his hands, while listening to someone

props.synopsis: Pony Ma's resurgence might seem like a positive signal of a more permissive market environment. But as we watch China's private sector grow, we should remember it follows China's unique playbook.

title.children: Are things looking up for China's tech billionaires?

image.altText: A young mum with brown hair taking a selfie with her young son, who has long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Children living with disability are over-represented in school suspensions and a new report has shed light on their cost to families and the broader economy.

title.children: Kids with disability suspended from school 'before an inspector comes' or as 'warning to other children'

image.altText: Kim Jong Un speaks in front of microphones with a red and yellow flag in the background

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un runs the 'model dictatorship' in North Korea. Here's how he got here.

title.children: 'Publicly executed to send a message': The brutal regime of Kim Jong Un

image.altText: Daniel Ricciardo wipes his face

props.synopsis: Daniel Ricciardo may well have turned his final corner in a F1 car after an emotional interview following the Singapore Grand Prix.

title.children: Tearful Daniel Ricciardo 'aware it could be it' for his F1 career

image.altText: Ben Zygier

props.synopsis: A new documentary aims to shed more light on the case of Prisoner X, who was identified as Australian man Ben Zygier. He'd been working as a spy for Mossad but his alleged crimes remain shrouded in secrecy.

title.children: How the man known as 'Prisoner X' went from suburban Melbourne to the heart of Mossad

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, Narenda Modi, Joe Biden and Fumio Kishida stand in a line next to each other.

props.synopsis: Here's four things Anthony Albanese's trip revealed about the Quad, leadership, language and life lessons.

title.children: Four takeaways from the prime minister's 48 hours in the US for the Quad

image.altText: NT DV thumb

props.synopsis: A litany of failures by Northern Territory police led to the collapse of an alleged domestic violence case against one of its own detectives.

title.children: 'Gross incompetence': How NT police botched alleged DV case against detective

image.altText: A concept image for Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium.

props.synopsis: A three-storey, underground car park at Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point AFL stadium is the latest known exclusion from the building cost estimates, a parliamentary hearing is told.

title.children: More items revealed as not being budgeted for in Hobart's proposed stadium costings

image.altText: Cameron Smith is sprayed with champagne

props.synopsis: Australia's Ripper team of Cam Smith, Lucas Herbert, Matt Jones and Marc Leishman claimed a total prize of $20 million by winning the LIV Golf League for the first time.

title.children: $20m payday for Aussie LIV golfers after team victory

image.altText: Tyson Fury scratches his head and grimaces

props.synopsis: Tyson Fury and boxing fans everywhere lamented another close call in the ongoing and fruitless quest for an all-British mega-fight between himself and Anthony Joshua, but there's still plenty to look forward to.

title.children: 'That's cost me 150 million': The cascading impacts of a boxing shock

image.altText: A notebook with the words "Susan Bartlett Suzanne Armstrong murders of 147 Easey St Collingwood"

props.synopsis: Detectives have been praised for collecting and preserving DNA materials during the original Easey Street investigation at a time when little was known about the use of the science in criminal cases.

title.children: Police investigating the Easey Street killings lauded for using a forensic practice that was yet to prove its worth

image.altText: Devni Vihara posing on a green lawn

props.synopsis: Women of Asian backgrounds reveal they've been told to "not be so ambitious" by earning more money than their partners.

title.children: Devni was told 'not to threaten' her ex-boyfriend's place by earning more money than him

image.altText: Apalachee High School in Winder, Georgia

props.synopsis: Four people have died and at least 21 were wounded during a shooting in a nightlife area in Birmingham, Alabama.

title.children: Four killed and dozens wounded in Alabama nightlife district shooting

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player stands smiling at a lectern with a medal around his neck, in front of a sign saying "Chas Brownlow".

props.synopsis: The AFL's gala night of the year is nearly here, as the league's best-and-fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here's everything you need to know about the big event.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the 2024 Brownlow Medal

image.altText: Kylie in a white shimmery dress infront of a glacial like prism.

props.synopsis: "I'm glad that we can finally share it with everyone," Australia's pop princess Kylie Minogue is set to tour early next year — with fans being treated to old classics and whole new album, Tension II.

title.children: Kylie Minogue reveals 'more dates to be announced' ahead of world tour
